intro: Sinopodophyllum hexandrum subsp. ramgopalii, commonly known as the Himalayan mayapple, is a member of the Berberidaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its distinctive umbrella-like cluster of leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant produces red berries that are toxic to humans but serve as a food source for certain wildlife. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes in the Himalayas. Its botanical features make it an important species in the study of alpine flora and traditional medicine.
